title: Methods in Neuroscience
description: The course is focused on understanding how information about brain and nervous system function can be determined from a wide range of experimental and data analysis techniques.
restrictions: __HEADER_0__Must be enrolled in one of the following Campuses:
prerequisites: NEUR 3001 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of C and (NEUR 3002 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of C or BIOS 4400 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of C) and NEUR 3003 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of C and (CS 1301 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or CS 1315 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or CS 1371 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D) and (BIOS 4401 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or BMED 2400 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or ISYE 3770 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or ECE 3077 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or PSYC 2020 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 3225 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 3670 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D)
